notes: Grand unified theory for APM2 agent-native holonic SDLC.
Designed for high information compression: structured claims + explicit mappings to laws, mechanisms, and metrics.
All statements are intended to be operationalizable as contracts, gates, reducers, and defect counterexamples.

doc.title: Grand Unified Theory of Agent-Native Holonic Software (APM2)

ENF-CLASS-01.statement: Only nodes with node_class=NORMATIVE may be referenced by gates/policies/linters. Nodes with node_class in {EXPLANATORY,BACKGROUND} are non-authoritative and MUST be ignored by enforcement.

ENF-ADMISSION-01.statement: Enforcement MUST require a valid attestation for this document before importing NORMATIVE nodes. If meta.integrity.attestation_ref is missing or unverifiable, enforcement MUST fail-closed and treat this artifact as EXPLANATORY-only.

ENF-COLLECTIONS-01.statement: Collections intended as sets MUST be encoded as maps keyed by stable IDs. If an array-of-objects is used for a set, it MUST be canonically sorted by id; out-of-order arrays are a schema violation.

ENF-ORACLE-01.statement: Open design questions (Q-*) MUST remain EXPLANATORY until resolved by an OracleRequest/Adjudication with receipt-backed evidence. Any resulting enforceable rule must be recorded as a new NORMATIVE node that references the adjudication resolution and evidence.

ENF-VERIFY-01.statement: Verification MUST satisfy the satisfiability predicate: Valid(Output, Receipt, Evidence) := VerifyReceipt(receipt) ∧ EvidenceSatisfies(contract, evidence) ∧ DigestBindingsHold(output, evidence).

ENF-OCAP-01.statement: Capabilities MUST NOT be discovered; they only enter a holon via explicit delegation events/receipts (PermeabilityReceipt / permeability.receipt).

ENF-HMP-01.statement: ASPIRATIONAL (until machine-checkable enforcement is implemented): Inter-holon messages MUST conform to the Holonic Mesh Protocol (HMP): envelope fields (protocol_id+version, message_class, message_id, hlc_timestamp, and any required commitments/receipts) MUST be present and schema-validated; unknown message classes or schema versions MUST be rejected (fail-closed).

ENF-COMPOSITION-01.statement: ASPIRATIONAL (until machine-checkable enforcement is implemented): Holonic boundaries MUST be closed under composition: cross-boundary interaction MUST use the canonical channel classes and versioned schemas/contracts. New ad-hoc boundary primitives (including raw chat logs as interfaces) are prohibited; interface changes require explicit governance and a versioned contract reference.

ENF-SUMMARY-01.statement: ASPIRATIONAL (until machine-checkable enforcement is implemented): All SummaryReceipts MUST declare a loss profile and provide selectors that deterministically address omitted facts/evidence by hash or range. Summaries without zoom-in affordances MUST be treated as narrative and are non-authoritative for high-risk promotion.

notes: JSON objects are hashed/signed only after canonicalization (e.g., JCS).
Protobuf signed messages forbid maps; map-like structures must compile to repeated fields sorted before signing.

thesis.one_line: APM2 is a closed-loop, verifiable control system that compiles intent into authoritative facts under bounded cognition, bounded authority, and non-stationary environments, and it improves itself by converting counterexamples into stronger contracts, gates, and primitives.

THESIS-01.statement: Agent-native software engineering is control engineering: sense -> plan -> act -> verify -> commit, repeated under leases, budgets, and stop conditions.
implications: Tool calls are sensors/actuators in a partially observable control loop; they are not incidental.
Unverified actuation is open-loop and causes state divergence; promotion requires gates and receipts.
Governance is not bureaucracy; it is a controller tuned for stability under measurement and actuation limits.

THESIS-02.statement: Truth in the factory is an authoritative monotone substrate (append-only ledger + content-addressed evidence) with deterministic addressability; agents act on bounded views committed to a ledger head/checkpoint, while mutable state (workspace, codebase) is a projection derived by reducers.
implications: Correctness and auditability must not depend on external platforms (forge, consoles); they are projections/adapters.
Recovery and replay are achieved by replaying facts through pure reducers; process memory is disposable (crash-only).
Merge semantics and compaction are part of the truth model, not an implementation detail.

THESIS-03.statement: The system must improve by converting evidence-backed counterexamples (defects/findings) into strengthened verifiers, refined context compilation, and stable primitives that reduce recurrence and waste.
implications: A CI failure is always a defect (even if the code is correct) because it is a counterexample to determinism/clarity and consumes avoidable work.
Scoped implementation should be actuation, not exploration; pack misses are context defects.
Countermeasures repair the factory (guardrails), not just the product.

SEP-01.name: Spec vs State
SEP-01.statement: Specification content (what should be done) is distinct from workflow state (what has happened). State is derived from facts; spec is referenced by digest (Plan-of-Record).

SEP-02.name: Claim vs Evidence
SEP-02.statement: Claims (summaries, approvals, narratives) are non-authoritative until bound to verifiable evidence and receipts; derived artifacts (summaries, indices) are not equivalent to raw evidence and must declare derivation + loss profile, with gates specifying when zoom-in to evidence is required.

SEP-03.name: Authority vs Convenience
SEP-03.statement: External platforms and tools may be used as convenience projections; correctness and auditability must not depend on them.

SEP-04.name: Authority vs View
SEP-04.statement: The ledger is authoritative; an agent's in-window context is a bounded, budgeted view committed to a ledger head/checkpoint and equipped with addressable selectors for any omitted referenced facts. Synchronization is by commitment hash, not by full history inclusion.

SEP-05.name: Interface closure over implementation freedom
SEP-05.statement: Holonic boundaries are the engineering surface: keep boundary primitives fixed and minimal, while allowing unlimited internal complexity. A holon-of-holons MUST present the same boundary contract as a leaf holon (closure under composition), so recursion does not create new protocol primitives.

notes: ASCII-only symbols for stable hashing and tool compatibility.
Mathematical statements are operational: each should map to a contract, verifier, receipt, or reducer.

SYM-p_theta.name: p_theta(y|x)
SYM-p_theta.meaning: LLM as stochastic conditional transducer over outputs y given context x.

SYM-s.name: s
SYM-s.meaning: Bounded view/representation (e.g., ContextPack + SummaryReceipts) committed to a ledger head/checkpoint; may omit history but must provide deterministic addressability (hashes/ranges) for zoom-in.

SYM-I.name: I(s;a_star)
SYM-I.meaning: Mutual information between representation s and correct action a_star.

SYM-S_t.name: S_t
SYM-S_t.meaning: Hidden environment state at time t.

SYM-O_t.name: O_t
SYM-O_t.meaning: Observation at time t (tool outputs, logs, repo state, ledger reads).

SYM-A_t.name: A_t
SYM-A_t.meaning: Action at time t (tool invocation, edit, proposal, gate execution).

SYM-T.name: T(S_t, A_t)
SYM-T.meaning: Environment transition function; constrained by sandboxing and capability policy.

SYM-b_t.name: b_t
SYM-b_t.meaning: Belief state approximation over S_t given observations O_<=t.

SYM-P.name: P(x)
SYM-P.meaning: Contract predicate over artifacts/states; correctness = satisfy P or emit structured failure evidence under bounds.

SYM-C_total.name: C_total
SYM-C_total.meaning: Total expected cost objective (tokens + tools + latency + error + security risk).

EQ-01.purpose: Model stochastic cognition; output is a proposal, not proof.

EQ-02.purpose: Finite context as a hard capacity constraint.

EQ-03.expr: Information bottleneck objective: maximize I(s; a_star) subject to |s| <= W
EQ-03.purpose: Justifies structured context packs and verifiable indices.

EQ-04.expr: POMDP framing: S_t hidden, O_t observed, A_t chosen, S_{t+1} ~ T(S_t, A_t), agent maintains b_t approx p(S_t|O_<=t)
EQ-04.purpose: Tool calls as sensing/actuation; stability requires closed-loop verification.

EQ-05.purpose: Projection theorem; durable truth is events, not mutable state.

EQ-06.expr: Stability binding: Stability = Contract + Receipt + Evidence
EQ-06.purpose: Authoritative promotion requires mechanical verification artifacts.

EQ-07.expr: Objective: minimize E[C_total] = E[C_T + C_U + C_L + C_E + C_S] subject to invariants
EQ-07.purpose: Verifier economics and risk-weighted gating as optimization under constraints.

C_U.name: tool_cost
C_U.meaning: Tool runtime and external resource usage.

PHY-01.name: Bounded context (finite W) and MDL as a hard budget
PHY-01.statement: If the minimal description length of correct behavior exceeds W, any injected context is necessarily lossy; ambiguity increases error probability.
failure_modes: hallucinated_linkage (agent infers relationships not supported by injected facts)
control_objectives: minimize defect_escape_rate correlated with missing context
minimize stuck_proxies (rollbacks, task resets) correlated with context poverty

PHY-02.name: Stochastic cognition: proposals require external verification
PHY-02.statement: LLM outputs are samples from p_theta(y|x); even at temperature 0, decoding is not logical entailment. Authority cannot be granted to claims without verification artifacts.
derived_rules: bind promotion to signed receipts + raw evidence artifacts
treat flakiness as first-class defects that puncture the determinism envelope
treat summaries as claims until pointer validation succeeds

PHY-03.name: Non-stationarity: temporal pinning and freshness are mandatory
PHY-03.statement: Dependencies, tools, policies, and model behavior drift; stability requires pinning a 'frozen world' for an episode and making freshness an explicit policy.
derived_rules: define expiration and drift thresholds by artifact kind and risk tier
reason against content-addressed snapshots (repo, locks, policies) per episode
represent and manage drift deltas explicitly when reconciling frozen truth with current reality

PHY-04.name: Distributed failure: retries, duplication, partitions are normal
PHY-04.statement: At-least-once delivery and partial failures are default; actuation must be safe under retries and convergence must be explicit under drift.
derived_rules: every side effect is idempotent or has explicit compensation/rollback
retries are conditional: issue idempotency keys and precondition/revision guards; if guards fail due to drift, no-op and replan
every tool actuation emits an execution receipt bound to a dedupe key
facts declare merge operators or conflict rule class; conflicts are recorded as defects
reserve consensus for small control planes; prefer convergent replication for data planes

PHY-05.name: Adversarial representation: security is an information+capability problem
PHY-05.statement: Adversaries target the bounded context channel (prompt injection, poisoned logs, malicious diffs). Safe operation requires dual-axis containment: authority confinement + audit/identity, including context-read firewalls.
derived_rules: attestation reduces transitive trust: downstream holons accept artifacts via evidence, not narrative
default-deny tool capabilities; no ambient authority
deny-by-default context reads outside ContextPacks; treat escalations as defects unless authorized
prevent confused-deputy: knowledge does not grant authority; bind capabilities to intent/parameters and require explicit escalation paths

PHY-06.name: Computability limits: autonomy cannot be absolute
PHY-06.statement: The halting problem and Rice's theorem imply you cannot generally decide termination, safety, or semantic correctness; practical autonomy must be bounded, constructive, and verifiable.
derived_rules: correctness = satisfy predicate P(y) OR return structured failure evidence under bound B
critical actions use restricted languages/schemas and canonicalization to reduce ambiguity
explicit adjudication points exist for irreducibly human/multi-stakeholder decisions

PHY-07.name: Search/branching explosion: degrees of freedom must be reduced
PHY-07.statement: Planning is search; naive branching explodes. The architecture must reduce branching via capabilities, schemas, decomposition, and stable indices so heuristic cognition operates in a tractable space.
derived_rules: constrain output spaces via schemas and canonical formats
externalize stable indices/manifests to avoid rediscovery
factor tasks into compositional subgoals with explicit dependencies
restrict allowed actions via capabilities and policy

PHY-08.name: Coordination bandwidth: locality and digest-first communication dominate at scale
PHY-08.statement: At civilizational scale, coordination latency/bandwidth—not raw compute—dominates. The holarchy must minimize cross-boundary traffic by communicating in digests, delegating locally, and escalating only compressed, auditable summaries.
derived_rules: prefer local work execution within a holon's cell/scope; avoid global broadcast
exchange commitments/hashes/receipts first; pull full artifacts on-demand under capability
publish multi-scale indices and SummaryReceipts as the primary routing/compression layer
propagate backpressure and budgets downward; never "spray" tasks without capacity signals

PHY-09.name: Exabyte evidence: storage/retention is a governed budget, not an implementation detail
PHY-09.statement: Exabyte-scale evidence cannot be retained naively. Evidence MUST be chunked, deduplicated, classified, and tiered; long-horizon auditability is preserved via monotone compaction (manifests + loss profiles + receipts), not infinite hot storage.
derived_rules: store large artifacts as chunked CAS + deterministic manifests; avoid monolithic blobs
tier storage (hot/warm/cold) by policy; only commitments and summaries are required to remain universally hot
GC is allowed only after publishing a monotone derived artifact that preserves audit commitments and declares loss profile
make retention, sampling, and redaction explicit policy decisions bound to receipts

PHY-10.name: Scale invariance: coarse-grained boundary signals are mandatory under recursion
PHY-10.statement: Holarchies only scale if boundaries coarse-grain. A holon (leaf or aggregate) MUST communicate via stable, low-variety boundary signals (digests, commitments, receipts, summaries + selectors). If an interaction requires more detail than the boundary allows, the correct response is recursion (spawn/decompose) plus zoom-in by hash under capability—not widening the interface or exporting internal traces.
derived_rules: treat cross-boundary bandwidth/attention as the scarce resource; optimize for digest-first exchange
never treat internal chat logs, scratchpads, or private state as boundary artifacts
prefer SummaryReceipts + selectors for routing and escalation; pull raw evidence only when demanded by risk tier
interface growth with holarchy depth is a scalability defect; composition must not add primitives

TRUTH-AX-01.statement: Truth is not a snapshot; truth is an append-only, hash-chained DAG of events with content-addressed evidence pointers.

TRUTH-AX-02.statement: Mutable state (workspace/codebase) is a non-monotone projection derived from truth; projections may be overwritten, recomputed, or replaced.

TRUTH-AX-03.statement: If it cannot be proven via a signed ledger event and evidence digest, it did not happen (within the factory).

TRUTH-AX-04.statement: Holons operate on bounded, budgeted views of truth (ContextPacks/snapshots/summaries) that MUST include a cryptographic commitment to the relevant ledger head/checkpoint and deterministic addressability for any omitted referenced facts.

TRUTH-AX-05.statement: Compaction and summarization are monotone operations: they publish derived artifacts as new events/artifacts referencing prior history by hash/range and declaring derivation method/version and loss profile; local archival/GC is non-semantic.

TRUTH-AX-06.statement: Truth is federated: each cell maintains its own monotone ledger+CAS; global truth is the union of cell truths plus explicit, receipt-bound cross-cell imports. No ambient trust exists across cells without evidence and policy.

TRUTH-AX-07.statement: Cross-cell synchronization is digest-first anti-entropy: exchange commitments and summaries, then pull evidence by hash under capability. Reserve BFT consensus for shared-authority control-plane facts; treat data-plane replication as convergent and eventually consistent.

MECH-LEDGER.name: Ledger
MECH-LEDGER.role: Topology of truth; append-only, tamper-evident event store.
properties: append_only
causal_links (DAG)
hash_chained
namespaced (holon/cell scopes)
single_writer + many_readers (implementation detail; multi-writer shared authority requires BFT consensus)
typed_events

MECH-CAS.name: Content-Addressed Store (CAS)
MECH-CAS.role: Data plane for evidence artifacts; deduplication, integrity, progressive disclosure.
properties: artifact_kind + classification
content_addressing (blake3)
evidence pointers from ledger

MECH-REDUCERS.name: Reducers / Projections
MECH-REDUCERS.role: Deterministic reconstruction of current state from events; crash-only recovery; audit queries.
properties: checkpointing/snapshots permitted as derived acceleration
projections are overwritable; facts are not
pure_state_transition (Reducer::apply)

federation_model.statement: Scale is achieved by sharding truth into cells (latency+trust domains) and federating them via receipts, indices, and anti-entropy. This preserves LAW-03 (monotone truth vs projection) without requiring global total order.

cell.definition: A cell is an operational and trust boundary that hosts a set of holons with a local ledger namespace space, local CAS, local policy evaluation, and (optionally) a local BFT control plane.
hard_invariants: cell-local ledgers are authoritative for cell-local work scopes
cross-cell reads/writes require explicit permeability via receipts and policy (no ambient authority)
cells publish periodic checkpoints and index summaries to support digest-first routing
cells MUST tolerate partitions: operate locally when safe; reconcile explicitly via anti-entropy with conflict recording

protocol_shape: exchange checkpoint commitments (ledger head hash, checkpoint id, summary receipts)
advertise manifests/index layers; do not push raw context by default
pull artifacts by CAS hash under delegated capability; verify hash+signature on receipt
record imports/exports as events with receipts to preserve auditability
safety_notes: treat cell boundaries as adversarial by default (LAW-05); verify everything (LAW-15)
prefer derived summaries for routing; require zoom-in to raw evidence for high-risk transitions (LAW-07, LAW-14)

monotone_substrate.statement: Facts are monotone additions within a declared join-semilattice; truth is the least-upper-bound of all observed events and evidence.
merge_algebra_requirements: Every domain MUST define a join operator (⊔) that is idempotent, commutative, and associative.
Every fact MUST declare its merge_operator OR conflict_rule_class; unresolvable forks are recorded as ProjectionConflictState.
ProjectionConflictState blocks authoritative promotion until an AdjudicationResolved or ConflictResolutionCommitted event joins the fork.
ordering dependencies must be explicit; hidden ordering is a defect
periodic compaction preserves provenance while controlling replay/MDL

non_monotone_projection.statement: Workspaces, codebases, and UIs are projections that can be rewritten; they are not the source of truth.
implications: audit reconstructs from ledger + evidence, not from narrative
external forge/branch state is not authoritative
filesystem scans are not authoritative for workflow state

holonic_boundary_model.definition: A holon is a Markov-blanketed actor: internal state is ephemeral; interaction occurs only through sensory inputs and active outputs across explicit channels governed by leases, budgets, and policy.

HB-01.name: Seclusion
HB-01.statement: Internal state (scratchpad, memory, variables) is private and non-durable; it dies with the process.

HB-02.name: Commitment Filter
HB-02.statement: Only selected checkpoints and outputs are committed as durable events/artifacts; commitment is a deliberate boundary crossing.

HB-03.name: Crash-Only Corollary
HB-03.statement: If internal entropy becomes high (confusion/errors), terminate and restart from committed state; do not attempt to recover corrupted private state.

HB-04.name: Janus Dualism
HB-04.statement: Each holon is simultaneously a whole to its sub-holons and a part to its supervisor; treat sub-holons as you are treated by your supervisor.

HB-05.name: Interface Variety Control
HB-05.statement: Supervisors control interface variety (typed signals/contracts), not internal complexity; this resolves Ashby's requisite variety at boundaries.

HB-06.name: Compositional Closure
HB-06.statement: Holonic interfaces are closed under composition: aggregates compress and summarize; they do not invent new boundary primitives. Boundary traffic is commitments/receipts/summaries with selectors; details are fetched by hash under delegated capability.

notes: Channel classes follow Principia Holonica: discovery/handshake/work/evidence/governance.
Discovery does not convey capabilities or authoritative claims; capabilities cross only via explicit handshake/permeability receipts.
Each channel has distinct semantics, budgets, retention, and trust posture.

CH-05.name: governance
governance: MUST be signed and hash-bound to an attested policy bundle
audited + rate limited; prefer broadcast via commitments, not payload flooding

lease.statement: A lease is time-bounded, scope-bounded, revocable authorization to act; work performed without a valid lease is void.
lease.subleasing_rule: Child leases are strict subsets of parent leases (narrower scope, lower budget).

budget.statement: Budgets bound time/tokens/tool_calls/duration; termination is mandatory on exhaustion.

ocap.statement: Authority is represented by possession of sealed capability handles; eliminate ambient authority by mediating all effects via tool capabilities.

stack_model.statement: APM2 is a stack of nested control loops: (1) episode loop, (2) work substrate lifecycle loop, (3) recurrence/self-improvement loop.
stack_model.principle: Each outer loop treats the inner loop as a plant with measurable outputs and controllable inputs; governance adjusts constraints based on feedback.
notes: Aligns with the agentic-reasoning split between in-context (test-time orchestration) and post-training (policy optimization): the episode loop is in-context; the recurrence loop is post-training and must itself be governed and evidence-bearing.

steps: orient (holarchy position, lease validity, budgets, policy)
requirements: all actuation is auditable as events with receipts
checkpoint intermediate intent-to-act and observations for fine-grained crash-only recovery
bounded exploration under leases; non-convergence is a defect

pipeline: Merge acceptance produces MergeReceipt binding inputs->output
Release/runtime telemetry linked back to work + evidence
principles: state transitions are authoritative only with gate receipts
Plan-of-Record digest prevents drift by commentary
ChangeSets are identity independent of forge transport artifacts
merge is a governed state transition, not a UI event

pipeline: GateRuns and runtime oracles emit Findings/DefectRecords
normalize and fingerprint to compute FindingSignature classes
reducers compute recurrence metrics over windows
countermeasure validates via corpus replay evidence + rollback plan
governance ratchets policies as verifiers become cheap and reliable
recurrence_self_improvement_loop.closure_rule: A defect closes only with a new/strengthened verifier that would have failed on the original counterexample and now passes, with receipts and evidence captured.
countermeasure_requirements: MUST ship with a regression corpus of historical finding signatures it eliminates.
MUST include a gate that falsifies the original counterexample in that corpus.
MUST hold out a subset of findings to prevent process-level overfitting (Goodharting).

context_discipline.statement: Scoped implementation tasks should avoid unplanned context discovery; research/discovery holons are exempt. Unplanned context discovery tool calls in scoped tasks are inefficiency defects.

MECH-CONTEXTPACK.name: ContextPack
MECH-CONTEXTPACK.role: Compiled, bounded view of context artifacts (plus selectors) enabling actuation under OCAP; each pack is synchronized by commitment to a ledger head/checkpoint.
contracts: binds to ledger head/checkpoint commitment (hash chain head or Merkle root)
includes selectors/pointers enabling auditable on-demand retrieval of omitted referenced facts
sufficient for task completion within granted capabilities; otherwise decompose/escalate per policy (containment dominates)

MECH-CONTEXT-COMPILATION.name: Context compilation
MECH-CONTEXT-COMPILATION.role: Refinement compiler stage that constructs ContextPacks as role-relative, capability-bounded sufficient-statistics approximations; if the smallest sufficient pack violates containment policy, fail-closed and emit decomposition/escalation work.

MECH-MDL-BUDGET-REFRACTOR.name: MDL-triggered refactoring
MECH-MDL-BUDGET-REFRACTOR.role: Emit refactoring work when API/interface MDL exceeds budget; 'clean code' as cognitive reach requirement.

MECH-GATES.name: Gates + GateRuns
MECH-GATES.role: Verification orchestrators with machine-checkable acceptance predicates and evidence contracts; GateRuns produce signed receipts and structured findings (stochastic evaluators are advisory unless reduced to terminal-verifier evidence).
properties: risk-tiered gate selection
independent verification (AAT as advisory check; terminal verifiers anchor promotion)
fail-closed on missing evidence in high-risk tiers

MECH-AGENTIC-SCAFFOLDING.name: Agentic scaffolding (planner/executor/critic/verifier separation)
MECH-AGENTIC-SCAFFOLDING.role: Stabilizes stochastic cognition by separating proposal from verification, using structured tool-use loops, and converting failures into durable counterexamples. Can be implemented with one model or a heterogeneous model team; the separation of duties is the invariant.
patterns: ReAct-style propose->act->observe loops (tools as sensors/actuators) with explicit traces
separation-of-duties: proposer != verifier for high-risk promotions (no self-approval)
reflection on failures: add to counterexample corpus and strengthen verifiers/rubrics
self-consistency via independent proposals for high-impact decisions

MECH-EVIDENCE-BUNDLE.name: EvidenceBundle
MECH-EVIDENCE-BUNDLE.role: Content-addressed artifact set sufficient to validate claims; includes provenance and replay semantics.
properties: content_hash references
classification and progressive disclosure
provenance (inputs, toolchain versions, environment identity)
replay_determinism_class

MECH-EVIDENCE-TIERING.name: Evidence tiering + manifests
MECH-EVIDENCE-TIERING.role: Exabyte-scale CAS discipline: chunking, deterministic manifests, tiered replication/retention, and redaction while preserving verifiable commitments.
properties: chunked_blobs + deterministic_manifest
tier_policies (hot/warm/cold)
classification + encryption-at-rest
GC only after monotone compaction publishes commitments and loss profile

MECH-RECEIPTS.name: Receipts (gate, merge, execution, summary)
MECH-RECEIPTS.role: Signed, machine-readable acceptance proofs binding claims to evidence and inputs/outputs in an attested environment (command transcript/tool versions/env digest or their hashes).
properties: tamper-evident (signed + hash-chained)
binds decision to bundle_hash and input/output digests
includes replay/attestation metadata (toolchain versions, runner image digest, policy version)
required for authoritative promotion

MECH-DETERMINISM-ENVELOPE.name: Determinism envelope
MECH-DETERMINISM-ENVELOPE.role: Explicit boundary for replayability; nondeterminism is recorded as an input dimension (seed/versions) or treated as a defect.
classes: non_replayable (treated as verification defect until stabilized)

MECH-SOURCE-SNAPSHOT.name: Source snapshots
MECH-SOURCE-SNAPSHOT.role: Frozen world state per episode; repo/lock/policy/model versions pinned by digest.

MECH-FRESHNESS-POLICY.name: Freshness policy
MECH-FRESHNESS-POLICY.role: Defines expiration/drift thresholds by artifact kind and risk tier.

MECH-IDEMPOTENT-ACTUATION.name: Idempotent actuation + dedupe keys
MECH-IDEMPOTENT-ACTUATION.role: Retry-safe effects under drift: each actuation binds to an idempotency/dedupe key, carries precondition/revision guards when applicable, and emits an execution receipt; guard failures trigger revalidation and replan.

MECH-ANTI-ENTROPY.name: Anti-entropy protocol
MECH-ANTI-ENTROPY.role: Explicit reconciliation of distributed state across holons/cells; digest-first periodic convergence with conflict recording.

MECH-FEDERATION.name: Federation (cells + cross-cell anti-entropy)
MECH-FEDERATION.role: Connects cells into a globally distributed holarchy via digest-first anti-entropy and receipt-bound imports, without requiring global total order for the data plane.
contracts: imports/exports are explicit events bound to commitments and receipts (never ambient trust)
data-plane replication is convergent; shared-authority control-plane facts may require BFT consensus
partitions are tolerated: local safe progress continues; unsafe cross-boundary effects are denied or deferred
conflicts are recorded as defects; reconciliation is never silent

MECH-MERGE-ALGEBRA.name: Merge algebra
MECH-MERGE-ALGEBRA.role: Declared merge operators or conflict rule classes for facts and receipts to avoid hidden ordering dependencies.

MECH-CONFLICT-RECORDING.name: Conflict recording as defects
MECH-CONFLICT-RECORDING.role: Reconciliation failures are explicit DefectRecords (never silent drops).

MECH-OCAP.name: Object-capability (OCAP) isolation
MECH-OCAP.role: Sealed tool handles constrain authority; prevents ambient authority and confused deputy.

MECH-PERMEABILITY-RECEIPT.name: PermeabilityReceipt (capability delegation across holonic boundaries)
MECH-PERMEABILITY-RECEIPT.role: The only legal path for capabilities to cross a holonic boundary. A PermeabilityReceipt grants a narrowly-scoped capability set with TTL, budgets, and audit bindings, signed by the delegator and recorded as a fact.

MECH-RELAY-HOLON.name: Relay holon (selective permeability bridge)
MECH-RELAY-HOLON.role: Perimeter bridge for contained holons/agents. Relays enforce outbound-only initiation from the contained side, mediate approved cross-boundary fetch/push operations, and log evidence for all boundary crossings.
properties: outbound-only connectivity from contained boundary
deny-by-default; only receipt-bound delegated capabilities are honored
digest-first transfer: exchange commitments then pull/push artifacts by hash
emits auditable execution receipts and redacted transcripts as evidence

MECH-LEASES-BUDGETS.name: Leases + Budgets
MECH-LEASES-BUDGETS.role: Time/scope bounded authority with resource limits; enforces termination discipline.

MECH-POLICY.name: Policy adjudication
MECH-POLICY.role: Default-deny least-privilege tool mediation; risk-tiered gate requirements; waiver governance.

MECH-AUDIT-IDENTITY.name: Audit + identity
MECH-AUDIT-IDENTITY.role: Every capability use links to stable identity and work ID; enables accountability and non-repudiation.

MECH-ATTESTATION.name: Attestation
MECH-ATTESTATION.role: Downstream trust is transitive through evidence: artifacts attested as produced under specific toolchains, inputs, and policy versions.

MECH-STOP-CONDITIONS.name: Stop conditions
MECH-STOP-CONDITIONS.role: Explicit success/failure/escalate predicates; non-convergence within budget is a defect.

MECH-SEMANTIC-TYPING.name: Semantic typing + canonicalization
MECH-SEMANTIC-TYPING.role: Typed, unitful, canonical boundary fields; canonical encodings prior to hashing/signing.

MECH-ORACLE-REQUEST.name: OracleRequest adjudication
MECH-ORACLE-REQUEST.role: Explicit escalation for high-entropy specification gaps; treated as refinement input, not silent out-of-band action.

MECH-WORK-DECOMPOSITION.name: Holonic decomposition + routing
MECH-WORK-DECOMPOSITION.role: Decomposes a large work objective into smaller work objects with explicit dependencies; binds decompositions to budgets and verification strategy (risk tier); the decomposition output is a WorkGraph (DAG of WorkIDs with explicit edges), enabling recursion without widening interfaces.
properties: outputs a WorkGraph: nodes are WorkIDs with typed specs; edges encode dependencies/parent_work_ids
each node declares stop conditions, budgets, and required receipts (risk-tiered)
interfaces between nodes are typed boundary signals (no implicit shared context)
upward progress is summarized as SummaryReceipts + receipts; downward requests are scoped and capability-limited

MECH-HOLON-DIRECTORY.name: Holon directory + routing
MECH-HOLON-DIRECTORY.role: Identity->locator discovery and routing layer for holons across cells. Directory facts are treated as non-authoritative until bound to receipts/evidence; the directory primarily routes via commitments and SummaryReceipts.
properties: event-sourced, eventually consistent
digest-first: route by commitments/hashes, not raw context
authorization gated by policy + permeability receipts
multi-scale (local->regional->global) summaries for scalability

MECH-HOLON-MESH-PROTOCOL.name: Holonic Mesh Protocol (HMP): digest-first inter-holon communication
MECH-HOLON-MESH-PROTOCOL.role: Defines the minimal, scalable inter-holon message shape: exchange commitments, receipts, and capability handshakes first; transfer full artifacts only by hash under delegated capability. This is the backbone for globally distributed, recursively nested holons without context flooding.
envelope_fields: interface_contract_ref (optional; stable ID of the boundary contract/schema)
message_classes: governance (stop_order propagation, policy update notification, contract negotiation)
non_goals: does not mandate a transport (gRPC/HTTP/queues are projections)
does not allow bypassing OCAP or policy; protocol is a shape, not an authorization

MECH-BACKPRESSURE.name: Backpressure + capacity signaling
MECH-BACKPRESSURE.role: Admission control for work intake and decomposition. Prevents coordination collapse by propagating capacity signals and budgets through the holarchy, and by making overload a first-class, observable condition.
properties: explicit queue depth + WIP limits per holon/cell
budget propagation downwards (child work) and upwards (escalation)
drop/defer policies are risk-tiered and auditable
work stealing is explicit and policy-governed (never implicit ambient takeover)

MECH-INDEX-LAYERS.name: Multi-scale index layers
MECH-INDEX-LAYERS.role: Hierarchy as compression: stable indices/manifests/summaries route and compress without losing verifiability (deterministic zoom-in).

MECH-SCHEMAS.name: Versioned strict schemas
MECH-SCHEMAS.role: Fail-closed schema validation for work objects, receipts, evidence, and policies; schema evolution is compatibility-gated.

MECH-EMERGENCY-STOP.name: Emergency stop + root-of-trust stop authority
MECH-EMERGENCY-STOP.role: Factory-wide kill switch: when active, deny all actuation except actions required to observe/verify stop state and to restore safety.

MECH-ROOT-OF-TRUST.name: Root of trust (keys, identity, signing policy)
MECH-ROOT-OF-TRUST.role: Defines which identities and keys are trusted to sign authoritative receipts and emergency controls; enables key rotation with chain of custody.
invariants: All authoritative receipts are verifiable against a trusted key set.
Key rotations are recorded as KeyRotated events that prove control of the old key.

MECH-COMPACTION.name: Ledger compaction + canonical snapshots
MECH-COMPACTION.role: Controls replay cost/MDL by publishing verified canonical snapshots/summaries as derived artifacts; preserves provenance via hash-links and replay-equivalence tests (local archival/GC is non-semantic).
invariants: Snapshot must retain a hash-link to archived history head(s).
Compaction is monotone: it publishes derived snapshot/summary artifacts as new facts; it does not delete semantic history.
Compaction must be accompanied by replay-equivalence evidence over declared queries/projections.
Snapshots/summaries MUST declare derivation method/version and loss profile for any discarded information.
Compaction is governance-scoped and risk-tiered; high-risk streams require stronger evidence.

MECH-SUBTASK-ISOLATION.name: Subtask context isolation
MECH-SUBTASK-ISOLATION.role: Enforces scoped ContextPacks per subtask; prevents cross-coupling via monolithic trace injection.
properties: subtasks receive scoped ContextPacks, not full history
inter-subtask state flows via typed summaries/receipts (LAW-07)
monolithic trace injection across subtask boundaries is a CONTEXT_BLEED defect

MECH-MONITOR-ISOLATION.name: Monitorability conservation
MECH-MONITOR-ISOLATION.role: Protects oversight/interpretability channels from optimization pressure. Monitors used for accountability/safety MUST NOT be incorporated into training rewards.
properties: oversight signals structurally isolated from reward signals
audit channel features excluded from gradient updates
violation produces MONITOR_GAMING defect
MECH-MONITOR-ISOLATION.rationale: Monitoring channels are themselves optimization targets. Training that rewards monitor evasion destroys the very interpretability needed for oversight.

MECH-EVALUATOR-AUDIT.name: Evaluator validity auditing
MECH-EVALUATOR-AUDIT.role: Gate evaluators MUST be periodically audited for false negatives and instruction-checker alignment. Non-deterministic or misaligned evaluators produce EVALUATOR_DRIFT defects.
properties: false-negative audit: correct work rejected
instruction-checker alignment validation
non-deterministic evaluators require statistical characterization
measured performance deltas must account for evaluator uncertainty
MECH-EVALUATOR-AUDIT.rationale: Evaluator fixes can materially swing measured success. Many 'agent gains' are within evaluator error bars.

MECH-REPETITION-DETECTION.name: Echo trap / repetition detection
MECH-REPETITION-DETECTION.role: Detects template-like repetitive reasoning patterns (entropy collapse, reward variance flatlining) as a termination trigger and defect signal.
properties: monitors reasoning entropy over sliding window
detects reward variance collapse
triggers termination on echo-trap detection
emits REASONING_DEGENERATION DefectRecord
MECH-REPETITION-DETECTION.rationale: Reasoning can collapse into repetitive locally-rewarded patterns ('Echo Trap'). This is a distinct failure mode from unbounded search.

MECH-MEMORY-GOVERNANCE.name: Durable memory governance
MECH-MEMORY-GOVERNANCE.role: Governance of the persistent semantic graph. All updates to durable memory (Index/CAS) MUST be causal ledger transitions; private working memory is exempt but ephemeral.
properties: mutations (assert/link/prune) logged as domain-specific ledger events
silent updates (index state changes without matching event) trigger SILENT_MEMORY_MUTATION defect
retrieval operations are auditable tools that return content-addressed subsets
memory evolution is a function of (State_t + Event) -> State_{t+1}
MECH-MEMORY-GOVERNANCE.rationale: Prevents 'split-brain' between the agent's learned state and the auditable log. Memory is a learned data structure that must be deterministically replayable.

INV-F-01.statement: Authoritative truth is append-only and tamper-evident (hash-chained, signed).

INV-F-02.statement: No authoritative state transition occurs without the required gate set producing a machine-readable receipt bound to evidence.

INV-F-03.statement: All boundary-relevant fields MUST be typed, unitful, and canonicalized before hashing/signing. All quantitative fields MUST use the Quantity encoding (value_i64 + unit + optional scale). Ambiguous strings at boundaries are defects.

INV-F-04.statement: Summaries are lossy derived claims treated as summary receipts with deterministic evidence pointers; admissible for planning/triage, but any gate requiring exactness MUST zoom-in to referenced evidence or fail-closed.

INV-F-05.statement: Capabilities are default-deny, least-privilege, time/budget bounded; context reads are firewalled with the same rigor as tools.

INV-F-06.statement: Actuation is retry-safe under drift via idempotency/dedupe keys, execution receipts, and precondition/revision guards; failed guards trigger revalidation and replan.

INV-F-07.statement: Convergence is explicit: merge operators/conflict rules declared; reconciliation failures are recorded as defects.

INV-F-08.statement: Freshness is explicit policy; authoritative artifacts are versioned and time-scoped; episodes reason against pinned snapshots.

INV-F-09.statement: Budgets and stop conditions are mandatory; unbounded exploration/non-termination is a defect.

INV-F-10.statement: Only gate what you can defend: verifiers must be designed for Goodhart resistance with holdouts/adversarial suites; safety constraints are separated from performance objectives.

INV-F-11.statement: All actuation paths MUST check stop state. If stop state is missing or unverifiable, deny (fail-closed).

INV-F-12.statement: Any compaction/snapshot MUST preserve auditability: a consumer can reconstruct acceptance decisions via hash-links to archived history and replay-equivalence receipts.

INV-F-13.statement: Bounded views (ContextPacks/snapshots/summaries) MUST carry a cryptographic commitment to the relevant ledger head/checkpoint and provide addressable selectors for any omitted referenced facts; view validity is by commitment hash, not by full history inclusion.

INV-F-14.statement: Constraint precedence: when laws conflict, apply Security/Containment > Verification/Correctness > Liveness/Progress. If containment forbids sufficient context or capabilities, fail-closed, decompose/escalate, and record a defect/decision.

INV-F-15.statement: Authoritative promotion requires terminal-verifier evidence: gate acceptance predicates MUST be machine-checkable and replayable in an attested environment; stochastic evaluators (LLMs) may orchestrate or advise but cannot be the sole basis for high-risk promotion.

INV-F-16.statement: Holonic interfaces are closed under composition: any holon (leaf or aggregate) MUST communicate using the same boundary channel classes and HMP envelope. Cross-boundary artifacts MUST be commitments/receipts/summaries with selectors; internal traces and private state are not valid boundary objects.

CMP-01.statement: SQLite WAL as ledger backend (now) is a replaceable implementation detail as long as event APIs, signatures, and reducer determinism remain stable.

CMP-02.statement: Length-prefixed JSON over Unix sockets (now) is a transport convenience; long-term, prefer typed canonical encoding for protocol stability and signature determinism.

CMP-03.statement: Git and external forges (now) are projections/transport artifacts; internal identities remain ChangeSet/GateRun/MergeReceipt digests independent of forge primitives.
improvement_path: internal forge UI and merge protocol

CMP-04.statement: Human-as-Oracle interventions are required while autonomy is immature; interventions must be explicit Decision/OracleRequest objects to enable later compiler improvement.
improvement_path: extract repeated oracle answers into refinement rules
reduce oracle demand via stronger contracts and better ContextPacks

CMP-05.statement: Gate portfolio starts thin for throughput; it thickens as recurrence data justifies and as verifiers become cheap/reliable; enforcement ratchets by governance control loop.

CMP-07.statement: Interface-closure enforcement SHOULD start as cheap schema/lint checks to preserve Forge Admission Cycle throughput; ratchet to merge-blocking only after the HMP/schema toolchain is stable and false-positive rates are low.
improvement_path: daemon-level fail-closed decoding for unknown schema/message_class
linter rules for boundary artifacts (SummaryReceipt required for cross-boundary narrative)

CMP-06.statement: Some artifacts will be non-replayable early (vendor tools, network services); record the boundary and treat it as a verification defect until stabilized.

MED.meaning: Structured tool outputs with digest bindings

HIGH.meaning: Verified terminal-verifier outcomes with independent attestation and digest bindings

FORMAL.meaning: Machine-checkable acceptance predicates executed in an attested environment (may include formal proofs or exhaustive hypothesis coverage)

notes: OracleRequest is a bounded-choice adjudication request used to resolve specification gaps or governance decisions.
Resolution MUST be receipt-backed (evidence + signatures) before resulting rules become NORMATIVE-enforceable.

T0.name: Experimental
notes: low-risk exploratory work

T1.name: Internal
notes: default internal work

T2.name: Production
notes: requires stronger gates

T3.name: Security-Critical
notes: highest rigor; fail-closed

gate.receipt.purpose: proof of gate outcome bound to evidence bundle

tool_execution.receipt.purpose: proof of external side effect execution bound to dedupe key

stop_order.receipt.purpose: proof of emergency stop state change

permeability.receipt.purpose: proof of boundary-crossing knowledge or authority delegation

notes: Never commit to symbolic refs like HEAD/branch names; always record resolved object ids.
Receipts should record (algo, object_id) to support SHA-1 and SHA-256 repos.
This is a minimal stable catalog of fact kinds for compiling doctrine into code.
Kinds with proto_ref exist today; kinds marked planned_extension are forward-looking and require schema work.

merge_semantics.ordering_rule: hash_chain_for_local_sequence; cross-ledger reconciliation requires conflict recording

notes: Envelope for all stored events; signed; carries actor_id and hash chain.

Q-01.question: What are the minimal non-negotiable invariants to enforce at runtime (the smallest LAW/INV set everything composes around)?
Q-01.why_it_matters: Defines the hard boundary of correctness and safety; everything else is optimization.

Q-02.question: What is the canonical unit of trust for downstream holons: EventRecord only, or EvidenceBundle+Verifier attestation, and when is each required?
Q-02.why_it_matters: Defines transitive trust; impacts storage, verification cost, and audit completeness.
Q-02.provisional_default: Treat EventRecord as routing fact; treat EvidenceBundle+Receipt as acceptance fact for any authoritative transition.

Q-03.question: How is 'context sufficiency' operationalized and measured (beyond subjective judgment)?
Q-03.why_it_matters: Bounded context is a primary failure driver; must be controlled via measurable surrogates.
Q-03.provisional_default: Adopt LAW-02 control objectives: pack-miss, unplanned tool calls, defect escape correlation, stuck proxies.

Q-04.question: What is the freshness policy: which artifacts must be temporally pinned, and where is pinning stored/verified (ledger fields vs evidence artifacts)?
Q-04.why_it_matters: Non-stationarity creates silent invalidation; pinning is required for replay and correctness.
Q-04.provisional_default: Pin per episode: repo digest + dependency locks + toolchain versions + policy version; store pins in evidence + reference from events.

Q-05.question: Where should gated promotion live: reducers, daemon handlers, tool-policy, or explicit GateRun work objects?
Q-05.why_it_matters: Defines who can block/allow authoritative transitions and how proofs are attached.
Q-05.provisional_default: Represent verification as explicit GateRun objects that emit receipts; reducers enforce that transitions require receipts by risk tier.

Q-06.question: What is the merge semantics model: are conflicts first-class events with explicit merge receipts, and what is the minimal audit-complete merge receipt?
Q-06.why_it_matters: Convergence and non-repudiation depend on explicit merge semantics.
Q-06.provisional_default: MergeReceipt binds (Plan-of-Record digest, ChangeSet digest, GateRun receipt digests, approver identity) -> output repo state digest.

Q-07.question: Which tool executions must be exactly-once vs at-least-once, and how is dedupe keyed?
Q-07.why_it_matters: Retry safety and external side effects require idempotency and accounting.
Q-07.provisional_default: Assume at-least-once delivery; require dedupe keys and execution receipts for all external effects.

Q-08.question: What is the budget model: per episode, per session, per work object, and what triggers escalation vs termination?
Q-08.why_it_matters: Bounded search and termination discipline are foundational; budgets encode priorities and risk posture.
Q-08.provisional_default: Episode budgets enforce immediate termination; session/work budgets govern escalation and scheduling (hardening, countermeasures).

Q-09.question: How is verifier economics managed: how do you prevent Goodharting gates and decide when a verifier becomes mandatory?
Q-09.why_it_matters: Proxy gaps are exploited under optimization pressure; gating must be defendable and cost-effective.
Q-09.provisional_default: Separate safety invariants from performance; maintain holdouts/adversarial suites; ratchet based on measured escape rates and verifier ROI.

Q-10.question: How do you define defect closure: what constitutes 'closed loop' remediation and who can waive it?
Q-10.why_it_matters: Without closure rules, defects become narrative; recurrence remains high.
Q-10.provisional_default: Defect closes only with strengthened verifier passing on original counterexample; waivers are explicit Decision objects with expiry.

Q-11.question: What are the top expected defect classes early and which countermeasures should be pre-built?
Q-11.why_it_matters: Early-stage defects are predictable (context omission, stale projections, tool misuse, prompt injection) and are best addressed systemically.

Q-12.question: What is the trust boundary between adapter observations and ledger truth: can adapters emit events directly or only propose observations that must be verified?
Q-12.why_it_matters: Adapters sit on untrusted surfaces; event authority must not be compromised by observation noise.
Q-12.provisional_default: Adapters propose observations; authoritative events require verification/attestation or trusted identity tier.

Q-13.question: How strict is OCAP in practice: are tools always default-deny with explicit leases, and is read-only mode first-class?
Q-13.why_it_matters: Capability containment is the primary security primitive; read-only sessions reduce blast radius.
Q-13.provisional_default: Default-deny always; read-only lease profiles are first-class and the default for review/audit.

Q-14.question: Where do humans enter the loop by design (explicit adjudication points)?
Q-14.why_it_matters: Human bandwidth is scarce; the system must request adjudication only at sharp points with bounded options and attached evidence.

Q-15.question: What is the primary success metric for early stages: throughput, correctness, safety, replayability?
Q-15.why_it_matters: Metric choice shapes incentives and gate design; premature throughput optimization is a common failure mode.
Q-15.provisional_default: Prioritize recurrence reduction and replayability (stability) before raw throughput.

Q-16.question: How do holons evolve boundary contracts (HMP schemas/interface_contract_ref) across federated cells without lockstep upgrades or interface proliferation?
Q-16.why_it_matters: LAW-16 requires compositional closure and stable primitives, but civilizational-scale deployment demands long-lived multi-version interoperability and safe deprecation. Poor versioning creates fragmentation or unsafe downgrade paths.
Q-16.provisional_default: Prefer monotone, backward-compatible schema evolution with explicit version negotiation via governance channel; support N-2 versions; treat breaking changes as new protocol_id and require migration receipts.

DEF-01.name: Unit of truth
DEF-01.statement: Truth = (append-only ledger events + content-addressed artifacts) plus deterministic addressability/retrieval; agents act on bounded views committed to a ledger head/checkpoint, not on unbounded full-history inclusion.

DEF-02.name: Context sufficiency
DEF-02.statement: ContextPack is the compiled sufficient-statistics artifact relative to an agent role and its granted capabilities; measure sufficiency via LAW-02 surrogates, treat pack misses as defects, and fail-closed/decompose/escalate when containment forbids sufficient context.

DEF-03.name: Freshness
DEF-03.statement: Pin world state per episode (repo+locks+policy+toolchain+model versions); enforce expirations by risk tier.

DEF-04.name: Merge semantics
DEF-04.statement: Require MergeReceipt binding input digests and gate receipts to output repo digest; conflicts are explicit events/defects.

DEF-05.name: Idempotency
DEF-05.statement: Assume at-least-once for all actuation; require idempotency/dedupe keys, precondition/revision guards when applicable, and execution receipts for external effects; guard failures trigger revalidation and replan.

DEF-06.name: Governance ratchet
DEF-06.statement: Start in observe mode; move to enforce-with-waiver; then enforce-hard as verifiers become reliable and cheap.

DEF-07.name: Early success metric
DEF-07.statement: Optimize for stability: recurrence reduction + replayability; treat throughput optimization as unsafe until loops are stable.

DEF-08.name: Constraint precedence
DEF-08.statement: Default precedence: Security/Containment > Verification/Correctness > Liveness/Progress. When containment forbids sufficient context/capabilities, fail-closed and decompose/escalate; record a defect/decision.

MET-CTX-01.name: pack_miss_rate
MET-CTX-01.definition: Fraction of episodes requiring context outside the provided ContextPack.

MET-CTX-02.name: unplanned_context_tool_calls
MET-CTX-02.definition: Count of tool calls executed primarily to discover missing context during scoped implementation episodes.

MET-CTX-03.name: defect_escape_rate_context_correlated
MET-CTX-03.definition: Rate of downstream defects correlated with missing/stale context indicators.

MET-CTX-04.name: stuck_proxies
MET-CTX-04.definition: Rollbacks, retries, resets, and non-convergent loops as proxies for context poverty.

MET-CTX-05.name: toolcall_information_gain_proxy
MET-CTX-05.definition: Binary metric: did a discovery tool call result in a material diff in the proposed plan or patch? Measures information value of exploration.

MET-CTX-06.name: counterfactual_pack_eval
MET-CTX-06.definition: Offline evaluation scoring: relative gate pass rate improvement when comparing Pack vN vs vN+1 on the same task corpus.

MET-VER-01.name: escape_rate_by_gate_set
MET-VER-01.definition: Probability of defect escape to later stages given a gate portfolio.

MET-VER-02.name: gate_cost
MET-VER-02.definition: Expected C_U + C_L cost per gate run (compute/time/tool calls).

MET-VER-03.name: false_positive_rate
MET-VER-03.definition: Rate of incorrect failures; impacts throughput and bypass incentives.

MET-VER-04.name: proxy_gap_indicators
MET-VER-04.definition: Signals of Goodharting (overfitting to gates, holdout failures, adversarial suite regressions).

MET-REC-01.name: finding_signature_rate
MET-REC-01.definition: Counts/rates of FindingSignature classes over time windows.

MET-REC-02.name: time_to_resolution
MET-REC-02.definition: Time from finding/defect to closure evidence.

MET-REC-03.name: post_countermeasure_delta
MET-REC-03.definition: Before/after recurrence delta attributable to a countermeasure, validated via corpus replay.

MET-SEC-01.name: capability_overgrant_events
MET-SEC-01.definition: Occurrences where tools or scopes exceeded declared least authority.

MET-SEC-02.name: context_firewall_violations
MET-SEC-02.definition: Attempts to read outside ContextPacks; includes denied reads.

MET-SEC-03.name: receipt_integrity_failures
MET-SEC-03.definition: Missing/invalid signatures, hash mismatches, or evidence omission at required boundaries.

MET-SRCH-01.name: progress_potential
MET-SRCH-01.definition: Composite metric of windowed novelty (no plan/patch hash change), repeated action patterns, and open-obligation count delta.

MET-INT-01.name: interface_surface_area
MET-INT-01.definition: Count of distinct boundary contract/schema versions used in cross-holon communication for a given holon/cell over a window. Growth with depth is a scalability/attack-surface signal; target is bounded growth (prefer zero).

MET-MRG-01.name: merge_conflict_rate
MET-MRG-01.definition: Frequency of merge conflicts by subsystem/interface; informs decomposition and interface stabilization work.

MET-MRG-02.name: conflict_recording_completeness
MET-MRG-02.definition: Fraction of reconciliation failures producing explicit DefectRecords (target = 1.0).

DOC-SPINE-05.title: Laws as Corollaries
contents: LAW-01..LAW-16 mapping to mechanisms and invariants

module_contract_template.goal: Every AGENTS.md begins by stating which part of the spine it implements and which laws it enforces.

LAW-01.name: Loop Closure & Gated Promotion
LAW-01.role: Defines authoritative promotion: no shared truth transition without verification receipts whose acceptance predicates reduce to replayable, machine-checkable terminal verifiers in an attested environment. Includes hierarchical gate separation for Planner/Executor layers with layer-specific budgets.

LAW-02.name: Observable Context Sufficiency
LAW-02.role: Defines measurable surrogates for role-relative, capability-bounded context sufficiency; drives context compiler optimization. Mandates subtask isolation with scoped ContextPacks and typed inter-subtask interfaces; containment conflicts force decomposition/escalation (fail-closed).

LAW-03.name: Monotone Ledger vs. Overwritable Projection
LAW-03.role: Separates truth substrate from mutable projections; authoritative truth is the monotone ledger + evidence + deterministic addressability, while agents operate on bounded views synchronized by ledger commitments. Requires merge algebra and monotone compaction (derived artifacts that reference history). Memory mutations are ledger events; retrieval is auditable tool invocation. Shared authority facts MUST be quorum-attested via BFT consensus.

LAW-04.name: Stochastic Stability
LAW-04.role: Since transducers (agents) are stochastic, stability is achieved only through the binding of Stability = (Contract + Receipt + Evidence) to replayable terminal verifiers and an explicit determinism envelope. Event ordering MUST rely on Hybrid Logical Clocks (HLC) to preserve causal determinism.

LAW-05.name: Dual-Axis Containment
LAW-05.role: Containment requires both Authority (Capabilities) and Accountability (Identity/Audit), including context-read firewalls treated as capabilities; containment dominates sufficiency and privilege escalations must be explicit. Connectivity for contained agents MUST use Relay Holons to preserve outbound-only security boundary.

LAW-06.name: MDL as a Gated Budget
LAW-06.role: MDL budgets enforce cognitive reach; triggers decomposition/refactoring when exceeded.

LAW-07.name: Verifiable Summaries
LAW-07.role: Summaries are derived receipts with evidence pointers and deterministic zoom-in; admissible for planning/triage, but gates needing exactness MUST zoom-in to evidence or fail-closed.

LAW-08.name: Verifier Economics (Goodhart Resistance)
LAW-08.role: Only gate what you can defend; holdouts/adversarial suites; safety constraints separated from performance targets. Includes monitorability conservation: oversight channels isolated from optimization objectives.

LAW-09.name: Temporal Pinning & Freshness
LAW-09.role: Versioned/time-scoped artifacts; frozen snapshots for episodes; explicit drift handling.

LAW-10.name: Anti-Entropy & Merge Semantics
LAW-10.role: Convergence requires explicit merge operators and conflict recording; periodic reconciliation.

LAW-11.name: Conservation of Work and Idempotent Actuation
LAW-11.role: Actuation must be retry-safe under non-stationarity via idempotency/dedupe keys, precondition/revision guards when applicable, and execution receipts; drift-triggered guard failures force revalidation/replan.

LAW-12.name: Bounded Search and Termination Discipline
LAW-12.role: Exploration runs under leases and stop conditions; non-convergence is a defect. Includes repetition/echo-trap detection as termination trigger and defect signal.

LAW-13.name: Semantic Contracting
LAW-13.role: Typed/unitful/canonical boundaries; versioned enums; canonicalization before hashing/signing. Includes canonical Quantity encoding for all quantitative fields.

LAW-14.name: Proportionality and Risk-Weighted Evidence
LAW-14.role: Gate strength scales with risk/blast radius; adaptive enforcement based on escape rates.

LAW-15.name: Measurement Integrity
LAW-15.role: Receipts are tamper-evident and evidence-bearing (inputs/outputs/hashes + command transcript + toolchain versions + environment digest/attestation); omission of required evidence is a defect; fail-closed in high-risk transitions. Includes evaluator validity auditing for false negatives and instruction-checker alignment.

LAW-16.name: Closure Under Composition & Boundary Contracts
LAW-16.role: Ensures recursion scales: holon boundaries use stable primitives regardless of internal scale. Aggregates summarize (SummaryReceipts/commitments/selectors) and delegate detail work downward; zoom-in is by hash under capability. Prevents interface proliferation, chat-log coupling, and boundary-based attacks.
